ai.summary: A 13.3 km moderate hike around the Fulking area in East Sussex, combining countryside lanes, chalk footpaths, and occasional woodlands. The route is notable for archaeological interest, with visible field boundaries and historic sites along the way. Expect a mix of open countryside and shaded sections, with gates and gentle ascents. The walk rewards with views of the rural landscape and a sense of local history.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly country lanes and chalk tracks, with grassy field margins and some woodland sections. Surfaces can be uneven and muddy after rain; gates and stiles are common. The route includes gradual rises and hedged paths providing shelter in summer. Suitable for hikers with moderate fitness.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and daylight hours before starting. Wear sturdy boots and bring a map or GPS. Stay on public rights of way, be mindful of crops and livestock, and use gates and stiles with care. Watch for muddy sections and uneven ground, especially after rain. Carry a charged phone, a small first aid kit, and let someone know your planned route and timing.
recommended_gear: Lightweight rain shell and/or waterproof overtrousers
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) is best for this walk, when paths are drier and countryside is most pleasant. Winter walks are possible but expect mud, shorter daylight, and more exposure to wind.

seo.title: Fulking Archaeology Walk – 13.3 km Moderate Hike in East Sussex, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Fulking Archaeology Walk in East Sussex, UK. A 13.3 km moderate hike through rural lanes, downs, and historic archaeological sites. Plan your day with tips on terrain, safety, and gear.
seo.h1: Fulking Archaeology Walk – 13.3 km Moderate Hike in East Sussex, UK
